definition: benefit/help
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
surname Yi
benefit/profit/advantage/beneficial/to increase/to add/all the more

sentences.english: The key function is enriching lung and kidney, beneficing pneuma.
We may prevent the early aging, may also benefit hepatorenal and can prevent the kidney empty lumbago.
sentences.chinese: 本方可防止早衰，又可以补益肝肾和能预防肾虚腰痛。

sentences.english: The soup is delicious, can heat appetizers, spleen tonic.
sentences.chinese: 这汤味道鲜美，能清热开胃，健脾补益。

sentences.english: The situation in weapons and equipment added little to the infantryman's spirit.
sentences.chinese: 环顾当时的武器和装备状况，对步兵精神毫无补益。

sentences.english: The company was not helped along by reducing the price of CPU.
sentences.chinese: 降低CPU价格的做法对公司的发展并无补益。

sentences.english: Life is the best medicinal liquor with great tonic effect.
sentences.chinese: 生命是最伟大的补益作用与药酒。

sentences.english: Only thus can the future of the revolution be benefited.
sentences.chinese: 这样，才于革命前途有所补益。

definition: to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
nourishing/nutritious
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
(TCM) to build up one's kidney yang/to boost male sex drive
tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful)/to eat such foods
to dispel cold (TCM)
efficacy
to improve blood circulation (Chinese medicine)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
to take a tonic (for one's health)
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
tonic
spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
to enrich the blood
to relieve (cold, rheumatic pain etc)/lit. to dispel pathogenic wind (TCM)
to moisten the lungs/to make expectoration easy (medicine)
